column4: no, i juyst ran apt-get update and get W: GPG error: http://security.ubuntu.com gutsy-security Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 40976EAF437D05B5
Sounds like you're missing the public key for just one application. Have you added a line to sources.list for something (maybe wine etc.)?
You didn't google the key did you?
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/update-manager/+bug/24061
that is nothing at all like my issue
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SecureApt
nice read...but there is NO UBUNTU info....all the keys in the examples are debian...so no dice there either
The key is there. It's a generic keyserver.
gpg --keyserver pgpkeys.mit.edu --recv-key 40976EAF437D05B5
gpg -a --export 40976EAF437D05B5 | sudo apt-key add -
it didnt work...so i ran it again: this is what i got:  key 2D230C5F: "Debian Archive Automatic Signing Key (2006) <ftpmaster@debian.org>" not changed
Dude. You've got to use the right key. Not the one in the example.
s what i got:  key 2D230C5F: Debian Archive"
You used the key from the example. Try the exact lines that I posted above.
gpg --keyserver pgpkeys.mit.edu --recv-key 40976EAF437D05B5
You ran exactly that?
i missed the one line....
sorry i lost my temper....
No probs.
Very frustrating, I know. Stupid computers :D
